CPA General Secretary on relations with WPK
articles.content:
CPA General Secretary on relations with WPK 
    Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary of the Communist Party of Australia p. Symon, when meeting with the DPRK Ambassador to his country on May 7, recalled that he visited the DPRK twice and was received by President Kim Il Sung. He said he admired the DPRK for convincingly advancing along the road of socialism chosen by itself even after the collapse of socialism in East European countries.
 The Bush administration recently invaded Iraq in defiance of the un and international law, resorting to reckless moves for its world domination, he said, adding that the progressive political parties of different countries should pool their efforts to conduct a worldwide peace movement against the U.S. arbitrary practice.    
 He stressed that he would make every effort to develop relations between the Communist Party of Australia and the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Congratulations to Palestinian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Palestinian Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Nabil Shaath upon his appointment as First Foreign Minister of the Palestine national authority.
 The message sincerely wished the foreign minister success as ever in his work to restore the legitimate national rights including the right of repatriation, self-determination and the establishment of an independent state of Palestine with Kuds as its capital.
